0.description: Erin Solstice finds an abandoned dilapidated inn on a hill. She is hurt tired and afraid of the Dragon and the "red-eyed things" she saw. She determines that it's probably safer inside than outside.
Erin teleported from her bathroom to this world after playing chess, without her phone. She believes the world is magic, not VR

After teleporting into a cave with a fire-breathing dragon, she then ran for her life. Through "rolling valleys and foothills" she looked for help. She stumbled upon "a bunch of little green things with red eyes and mouths full of teeth" that tried to cut her. She wondered if they were goblins.

Erin explores the first floor of the inn looking for cleaning equipment. She walks into the kitchen and sees, "A pot, cast-iron pan, and a few other utensils". She finds a bucket to hold water from the rain outside to use in cleaning up. She looks for a dustrag on the second floor but instead finds curtains as a replacement.

The first leveling in the story. As Erin Solstice falls asleep she hears "[Innkeeper Level 1!]" and "[Skill – Basic Cleaning obtained!]" for her cleaning and supplementally, and gets "[Skill – Basic Cooking obtained!]" due to the acquiring of the class.

1.description: After waking up and hearing the level-up announcement, Erin comes to terms with being in a new world. Full of magic, Dragons, and Goblins. She heads outside she notices the oddities of this world, the clouds in the sky are much higher and larger than Earth. The land around the inn is rolling hills and valleys. "If you walked carelessly, you could lose track of your surroundings and find yourself in a valley thousands of feet wide". Seemingly the season was Fall, Earth was at some time in Summer but she couldn't remember when. All this helped bring home that this was a different world. She also spots "what looked vaguely like buildings. No, a wall of stone? Was there a town out there? Or a village? A…city?". It was too far to tell from this distance. Another thing she spots is a "small collection of trees in the distance", with specks of yellow and blue on the trees.

data.location: Walking between the inn and blue fruit trees
data.label: A rock!

1.description: Erin starts walking to the trees in the distance to identify what is on them. On the way there she meets a wild rock! or well a giant crab, "it was also taller than a school bus, if not as wide.", under a rock that tries to kill her. She escapes the encounter and then heads to the trees.

Upon inspecting the trees she finds that they are unnaturally tough, not able to even break off a twig from the branches. She shakes the trees to get the blue fruit to fall and picks it up but no system announcement for getting the fruit.

characters.alias: A female friend of a Dragon

1.description: A dragon remembering the human that teleported into his cave. He was sleeping so he was surprised at her appearance, not as much as her. He wonders if it was a spy from a [Necromancer], another dragon, or maybe " [Knights]? A random [Hero]?". A contingency message was sent in his surprise during the encounter to an unknown friend, wondering about his status. After finding no one or magic tracking or out-of-place after two weeks he determines it to be bad luck. "She had to have been the subject of—of some chance. Maybe a [Gambler] or whatnot". After doing some errands through magic to a nearby city he falls asleep in his cave.

2.description: Erin gets hungry and dissects the blue-looking fruit. She finds it is mostly skin with a giant seed that upon breaking with a rock splits open with pulp and juice that smells like "an incredibly powerful chemical smell similar to antifreeze". Next attempt she tries to eat only the skin of another fruit and find out they're really tasty.

Erin needs to get back to the inn past the inn and use the blue fruit cores to hopefully dissuade the rock crab creature from attacking her. It's super effective! She goes back to the trees to get more for her "breakfast, lunch, and dinner", but she finds goblins where she just was and runs away when they start approaching her

The chapter opens with Erin jumping over a stream "down a hill a few hundred feet away from the inn", where she could gather water from if not being chased by goblins. They carried crude weapons. She gets back to the inn before they catch her but they were most likely just "letting her use up all her energy before closing in for the kill."

She closes the front door with a bar to hold it closed and shutters all the windows on the first floor. She then realizes there is a second floor and needs to close those windows as well. While closing them she finds a skeleton in one of the beds. While she is upstairs seven goblins get in by breaking the shutters. Erin runs downstairs to defend. She gets cut but starts to punch, kick, and throw chairs to defend herself. She beats/knocks out more than half of them and scares them off because she is not the easy prey they assumed. After the fight ends she falls asleep and reaches "[Innkeeper Level 4!]".

data.location: Blue fruit forest and a cave
data.label: Goblins retreat

2.description: The point of view changes to a small young goblin reflecting on the failed attack. She has no name as " Goblins didn’t have names. Only their [Chieftain] had any real title". 3 of the goblins weren't even warriors but "They should have killed her". They went back to the blue fruit trees to get the fruit they left behind. They went back to the cave where their tribe stayed. The tribe's chieftain wanted to know why they were hurt but they didn't want to tell him they were beaten by one human, and that they let her live. The chieftain mentions that there should be more goblins and a [Shaman].

3.description: Erin wakes up hungry, so she goes back to the blue fruit trees, eats fourteen, and brings the cores back to use as weapons. She tries to look for branches for firewood but finds none on the ground. She cleans up the inn after the raid and thinks about the raid. She realizes that the goblins are like little kids. She also remembers that that they were not hunting her originally, but harvesting the fruit, making her realize they live close and worries her. The cleaning seems to be going much faster than she would think it would take but ignores that. Her most pressing issue it a lack of water.

After the Erin attack and not drinking anything in two days, Erin goes looking for some water. She walks around, a bit delirious from the dehydration but remembers the stram she jumped over during the chase. She drinks and bathes in the creak. While in the water she realizes that the reason that she was able to clean the inn so well was due to the  [Basic Cleaning] skill she received the first night. As she was bathing and thinking about the world and what she has experienced so far, a massive, "mutant fish with teeth" jumped at her. Ering makes it to the bank without being too hurt and waits for it to die, with some shenanigans.

After Erin carries the heavy fish to the inn's kitchen, she attempts to butcher it with a knife she found. It is difficult to cut it, but when she finally pierces the fish and looks inside she can see a yellow thing that vibrates when poked. It also sees some "pale yellow-white pus ooze" from inside. She assumes that this would be easy due to having the [Basic Cooking] skill but nothing special is happening. She realizes that maybe it needs to be cooked with a pan in the kitchen. As she goes back to butchering, her hand slips and slices her palm open.

Due to slicing her hand and not having any bandages she makes use of the curtains from upstairs but it does not help much. She eventually passes out and wakes back up in the morning with her hand still hurting and slightly bleeding into a puddle on the floor. She sat there all day in agony trying to not scream and trying to play chess in her mind to distract her.

4.description: Due to slicing her hand and not having any bandages she makes use of the curtains from upstairs but it does not help much. She eventually passes out and wakes back up in the morning with her hand still hurting and slightly bleeding into a puddle on the floor. She sat there all day in agony trying to not scream and trying to play chess in her mind to distract her. The next day she decides to go outside but when coming back she doesn't realize that the door of the inn had been opened when she purposely closed it behind her when she left. The 'bandage' needed to come off as it was "sodden with water" after attempting to clean it off in the stream. She couldn't get the entire bandage off and went looking for something else than a knife to remove the left over pieces.

In the kitchen cupboards, Erin finds flour and butter perfectly preserved. But as "Erin stared around the kitchen. Dust and cobwebs seemed to make up most of the room". She finds " a line of glowing, incomprehensible symbols" on the cupboard and figures out it must be some magical runes. She finds them on most cupboards in the room but only one is still functional after all this time. Curiously she touches the working rune and breaks off a splinter, breaking the rune and disrupting the magic until it fades to dark and stops functioning.

After destroying the rune in the kitchen Erin falls into a bit of depression and questions what the circumstances of the previous owner. She remembers the skeleton upstairs and goes to take a look. When she gets there it is gone. She spirals further wondering if the skeleton can move through magic or if it was valuable to the goblins and they took it. She then realized that the door was open when she arrived back in the morning. From behind her, she heard a creak coming up the stairs. She spiraled even further wondering who or what would be there and she was no hero. To her relief, it was just a goblin and not something she couldn't handle.

A group of 7 goblins wait outside the inn prepared to ambush the human when they expect her to chase the goblin that went inside. Surprisingly the human throws the small goblin and then retreats into the inn. The young female goblin followed this raiding party to see what would happen. An unknown third party watches both the inn and the goblins, realizing that a woman did live in there and wondering why she was doing out there. He seemed to have been in the inn and stolen the skeleton trying to work on a project with them.

5.description: When waking up after the goblin raid Erin smells the foul fish in the kitchen. She brings it outside and drops it on the ground but it exploded on the ground. She then tries to was off the cuttingh board the fish was on in the stream. She then see a bunch of flies from inside the fish hanging on to the cutting board. When she flicks one it explodes and some of it hits her and "both the board and her arm began to smoke and dissolve". Erin then names them "Acid flies".

A [Guardswoman] Beilmark and a rookie see some smoke coming out of the inn on the hill in the distance contemplating who or what could be starting a fire. Belimark then tells the rookie to get two Senior Guardsmen to do a patrol to see what is the situation. Those two's names are Relc and Klbkch.
Erin goes to get water for the baking and gets scared by what she believes is a pterodactyl. It flies away and leaves eggs for her to grab.

6.description: Erin goes to get water for the baking and gets scared by a Razorbeak. It flies away and leaves eggs for her to grab.

5.description: While walking back to the inn Erin notices a sign that says 'Open' and 'Closed' outside and realizes they also speak English in this world. There was also another word below in another language she didn't know. She jokes and wants to create a sign saying ‘no Goblins allowed’

After getting water and eggs Erin decides to make pasta. She freaks out a bit when some red streak comes out from the eggs realizing the chicks were alive. While waiting for the noodles to boil she decides to turn the blue fruits into blue fruit juice, similar to a smoothie.

6.description:
"A giant insect" / "ant-creature", later in the encounter found out to be Klbkch, knocks on the door and greets Erin, as "Miss Human". She immediately slams the door and starts looking for her knife. After Relc says Klbkch did it wrong he tries to instead. Erin looks out the window and sees a "Dragon-man". She drags a table in front of the door. She calls out asking if he is a dragon but responds that he is a drake. He goes on to tell her that the two of them are "Senior Guardsman" on the City Watch of Liscor and are on patrol. She lets them in and asks them if they want something to eat. She offers her pasta, some water, and blue juice; scared they might hurt her if she doesn't offer food. They tell her that they saw the smoke and came to investigate. Then they start asking questions about her origins. She tells them she was teleported and they assume a [Teleport] spell which would be a discussion for the Mage Guild. She says that she met a dragon and that there was a distinction between dragons and drakes and it was very unlikely for her to meet a dragon. Also learned the pterodactyl she saw earlier was a Razorbeak. They tell her it is dangerous living outside the city. They find out she is an innkeeper ask how she made the food and discuss the "preservation spell" on the cupboards.

Terms first heard in this scene: Ancestors (exasperation), Oldblood, Drake, City Watch, Corusdeer, Mage Guild, Razorbeak, City of Liscor

After eating Erin asks Klbkch and Relc some roundabout questions of leveling. She finds out Relc is a [Spearmaster] and Klbkch is a [Swordslayer] and both are [Guards]. So people can have more than one class. They find it odd that Erin only has 4 levels in [Innkeeper]. They also talk about how you level only when you go to sleep. They also tell her that she "must have satisfied the requirements for the class" which can happen suddenly from time to time. Erin finds out some species are incapable of leveling like dragons and non-thinking creatures. In the pasts there was a fight from all species to get the ability to level, some creatures decided not to gain the ability to level and kept their innate abilities instead. Relc also gets mad when Erin calls him a lizard person, he specifies "I’m a Drake, not one of the Lizardfolk. There’s a big difference." Some drakes can breathe fire but he can't. After leaving, later, she will receive "[Innkeeper Level 5!][Skill – Basic Crafting obtained!]"

Terms learned: classes, Lizardfolk

Relc noticed that Erin cut and asked for her to remove the bandage. She says it's infected but Relc identifies it to be poised by the fish in the waters in the area. Kldkch grabs a bottle of glowing green liquid and says it's a " low-grade healing potion. If you pour it over your injury, it should heal your affliction." It works and Erin gives him a hug for treating her. They leave after this and do not expect her to pay.

The two of them discuss Erin on the way back to the city before nightfall to clock out and give a report to Watch Captain Zevara. While discussing her they obviously have never interacted with a human for very long even a female one at that. Klbkch species is not "Ant" but "Antinium". They believe she is a runaway [Lady], maybe not even from this continent. They could tell she was not lying about seeing a dragon but believed she was most likely mistaken she would not have survived as they are known to defeat armies and none were nearby. They decide to go back to the inn during work the next day as part of an "investigation". The low-grade health potion was not merely low-grade and was a special order for other events. They would need to wait for a new shipment from "Pallas" when the "Blood Fields are frozen". Klbkch deems it worth using on a civilian in need.

Terms first heard: Antinium, Watch Captain, Pallass, Blood Fields
